Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: sendMessage(_:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: sendMessage asynchronously sends a given message and returns the response data. This function may throw an error if the message is invalid or the send operation fails.

Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: sendMessageParseMessage(msg:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: sendMessageParseMessage asynchronously sends a given message and returns the response message object. This function may throw an error if the message is invalid, the send operation fails, or the response message is invalid.

Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: packMessage(msg:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: packMessage asynchronously packs a given message object into a string representation. This function may throw an error if the message object is invalid.

Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.name: unpackMessage(msg:)
Structs/MercuryImpl.html#/s:7Mercury0A4I.abstract: unpackMessage asynchronously unpacks a given string representation of a message into a message object. This function may throw an error if the string is not a valid message representation.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.name: createRandomSeed()
Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: createRandomSeed creates a random seed and a corresponding set of mnemonic phrases.

Structs/ApolloImpl.html#/s:6Apollo0A4Imp.abstract: compressedPublicKey compresses a given public key into a shorter, more efficient form.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: rsa
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: RSA is an asymmetric algorithm used for both encryption and digital signatures.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: dsa
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: DSA (Digital Signature Algorithm) is primarily used for digital signatures.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: aes
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) is a symmetric encryption algorithm.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: des
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: DES (Data Encryption Standard) is an older symmetric encryption algorithm that’s considered insecure today.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: _3des
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: 3DES (Triple DES) is an enhancement of DES that applies the DES algorithm three times on each data block. It’s represented as “3des” in the string.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: cast
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: CAST is a family of symmetric encryption algorithms.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: ec
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: EC (Elliptic Curve) is used in asymmetric cryptography for encryption, digital signatures, and key agreement.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: rawKey
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: Represents a kSecAttrKeyClassKey. It’s a key type that doesn’t leverage the SecKey API for cryptographic operations. This can be thought of as a raw representation of a key, without being tied to specific cryptographic operations or algorithms.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: genericPassword
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: A generic password representation, not associated with any specific cryptographic algorithm.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.name: firstUnlock(deviceOnly:)
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.abstract: Key is accessible after the first device unlock.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.name: unlocked(deviceOnly:)
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.abstract: Key is accessible as long as the device is unlocked.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.name: passwordSet
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.abstract: Key is accessible when a password is set.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.name: Accessability
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ac.abstract: Represents the accessibility of the key in the keychain.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.name: KeyAlgorithm
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties/Ke.abstract: Represents the cryptographic algorithm of the key.

Structs/PEMKey.html#/s:6Domain6PEMKeyV7k.name: keyType
Structs/PEMKey.html#/s:6Domain6PEMKeyV7k.abstract: The type of the key. This corresponds to the type string found in the PEM encoding, such as ‘RSA PRIVATE KEY’ or ‘PUBLIC KEY’.

Structs/PEMKey.html#/s:6Domain6PEMKeyV7k.name: keyData
Structs/PEMKey.html#/s:6Domain6PEMKeyV7k.abstract: The raw data representation of the key. This is the actual binary data for the key.

Structs/PEMKey.html#/s:6Domain6PEMKeyV7k.abstract: Creates a PEMKey instance with the provided key type and raw key data.

Structs/PEMKey.html#/s:6Domain6PEMKeyV10.abstract: Returns a PEM-encoded string representation of this PEMKey.

Structs/DIDDocument/AssertionMethod.html.abstract: The URIs of the assertion method property.

Structs/DIDDocument/AssertionMethod.html.abstract: The Verification Methods of the assertion method property.

Structs/DIDDocument/Services.html#/s:6Do.abstract: The values of the “services” property, represented as an array of Service structs.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethods..name: values
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethods..abstract: The values of the “verification methods” property, represented as an array of VerificationMethod structs.

Structs/DIDDocument/Controller.html#/s:6.name: values
Structs/DIDDocument/Controller.html#/s:6.abstract: The values of the “controller” property, represented as an array of DIDs.

Structs/DIDDocument/AlsoKnownAs.html#/s:.name: values
Structs/DIDDocument/AlsoKnownAs.html#/s:.abstract: The values of the “also known as” property, represented as an array of strings.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service/ServiceEndpo.name: accept
Structs/DIDDocument/Service/ServiceEndpo.abstract: The types of content that the service endpoint can accept.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service/ServiceEndpo.name: routingKeys
Structs/DIDDocument/Service/ServiceEndpo.abstract: The routing keys that can be used to route messages to the service endpoint.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service/ServiceEndpo.name: ServiceEndpoint
Structs/DIDDocument/Service/ServiceEndpo.abstract: Represents a service endpoint, which is a URI and other information that indicates how to access the service.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html#/s:6Dom.name: id
Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html#/s:6Dom.abstract: The ID of the service, represented as a string.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html#/s:6Dom.name: type
Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html#/s:6Dom.abstract: The types of the service, indicated as an array of strings.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: id
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: The ID of the verification method, represented as a DID URL.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: controller
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: The controller of the verification method, represented as a DID.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: type
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: The type of the verification method, indicated as a string (e.g. “EcdsaSecp256k1VerificationKey2019”).

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: publicKeyJwk
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: The public key of the verification method, represented as a JSON Web Key (JWK).

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: publicKeyMultibase
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: The public key of the verification method, represented as a multibase encoded string.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.name: VerificationMethod
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethod.h.abstract: Represents a Verification Method, which is a public key or other evidence used to authenticate the identity of a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html.name: Service
Structs/DIDDocument/Service.html.abstract: Represents a Service, which is a capability or endpoint offered by a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/AlsoKnownAs.html.name: AlsoKnownAs
Structs/DIDDocument/AlsoKnownAs.html.abstract: Represents a “also known as” property, which is a list of alternative names or identifiers for a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Controller.html.name: Controller
Structs/DIDDocument/Controller.html.abstract: Represents a “controller” property, which is a list of Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) that control the associated DID or subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethods..name: VerificationMethods
Structs/DIDDocument/VerificationMethods..abstract: Represents a “verification methods” property, which is a list of Verification Methods associated with a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Services.html.name: Services
Structs/DIDDocument/Services.html.abstract: Represents a “services” property, which is a list of Services associated with a Decentralized Identifier (DID) or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/Authentication.html.name: Authentication
Structs/DIDDocument/Authentication.html.abstract: Represents an “authentication” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to authenticate the associated DID or subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/AssertionMethod.html.name: AssertionMethod
Structs/DIDDocument/AssertionMethod.html.abstract: Represents an “assertion method” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to assert the authenticity of a message or credential associated with a DID or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/KeyAgreement.html.name: KeyAgreement
Structs/DIDDocument/KeyAgreement.html.abstract: Represents a “key agreement” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to establish a secure communication channel with a DID or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityInvocation.name: CapabilityInvocation
Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityInvocation.abstract: Represents a “capability invocation” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to invoke a specific capability or service provided by a DID or other subject or object.

Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityDelegation.name: CapabilityDelegation
Structs/DIDDocument/CapabilityDelegation.abstract: Represents a “capability delegation” property, which is a list of URIs and Verification Methods that can be used to delegate a specific capability or service provided by a DID or other subject or object to another subject or object.

Structs/DID.html#/s:6Domain3DIDV6stringS.name: string
Structs/DID.html#/s:6Domain3DIDV6stringS.abstract: String representation of this DID as specified in w3 standards

Structs/DID.html#/s:6Domain3DIDV6stringA.name: init(string:)
Structs/DID.html#/s:6Domain3DIDV6stringA.abstract: Simple initializer that receives a String and returns a DID

Structs/Claim/ClaimType.html#/s:6Domain5.abstract: Provides comparison between two ClaimType instances based on their inherent values.

Structs/Claim/ClaimType.html.name: ClaimType
Structs/Claim/ClaimType.html.abstract: ClaimType represents the type of value a Claim can hold. This can be a string, boolean, date, data, or number.

Structs/Claim.html#/s:6Domain5ClaimV5val.name: value
Structs/Claim.html#/s:6Domain5ClaimV5val.abstract: The value of the claim, represented as a ClaimType.

Structs/Claim.html#/s:6Domain5ClaimV3key.name: init(key:value:)
Structs/Claim.html#/s:6Domain5ClaimV3key.abstract: Initializes a new Claim with the provided key and value.

Structs/Claim.html.name: Claim
Structs/Claim.html.abstract: Claim represents a claim in a credential. Claims are the attributes associated with the subject of a credential.

Structs/DID.html.name: DID
Structs/DID.html.abstract: A DID is a unique and persistent identifier for a subject or object, such as a person, organization, or device. It is created and managed using a specific DID method, and consists of a schema, method, and method ID. The schema indicates the type of DID (e.g. “did”), the method indicates the specific protocol or process used to resolve and manage the DID (e.g. “prism”), and the method ID is a unique identifier within the DID method.

Structs/DIDPair.html.name: DIDPair
Structs/DIDPair.html.abstract: Represents a pair of DIDs, typically used for secure communication or delegation of capabilities or services.

Structs/DerivationPath.html.name: DerivationPath
Structs/DerivationPath.html.abstract: DerivationPath is a structure that represents the path for key derivation in hierarchical deterministic (HD) wallets.

Structs/JWK.html.name: JWK
Structs/JWK.html.abstract: The JWK structure represents a JSON Web Key.

Structs/PEMKey.html.name: PEMKey
Structs/PEMKey.html.abstract: The PEMKey structure represents a cryptographic key in PEM (Privacy-Enhanced Mail) format.

Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties.ht.name: KeychainStorableKeyProperties
Structs/KeychainStorableKeyProperties.ht.abstract: Represents properties required for storing keys in a keychain.

Structs/Signature.html.name: Signature
Structs/Signature.html.abstract: The Signature structure represents a signature produced by a SignableKey.

Structs/Message.html.name: Message
Structs/Message.html.abstract: The Message struct represents a DIDComm message, which is used for secure, decentralized communication in the Atala PRISM architecture. A Message object includes information about the sender, recipient, message body, and other metadata. Message objects are typically exchanged between DID controllers using the Mercury building block.

Structs/AttachmentHeader.html.name: AttachmentHeader
Structs/AttachmentHeader.html.abstract: The AttachmentHeader struct represents the header for a DIDComm attachment.

Structs/AttachmentJws.html.name: AttachmentJws
Structs/AttachmentJws.html.abstract: The AttachmentJws struct represents a DIDComm attachment containing a JWS (JSON Web Signature).

Structs/AttachmentJwsData.html.name: AttachmentJwsData
Structs/AttachmentJwsData.html.abstract: The AttachmentJwsData struct represents a DIDComm attachment containing JWS data.

Structs/AttachmentBase64.html.name: AttachmentBase64
Structs/AttachmentBase64.html.abstract: The AttachmentBase64 struct represents a DIDComm attachment containing base64-encoded data.

Structs/AttachmentLinkData.html.name: AttachmentLinkData
Structs/AttachmentLinkData.html.abstract: The AttachmentLinkData struct represents a DIDComm attachment containing a link to external data.

Structs/AttachmentJsonData.html.name: AttachmentJsonData
Structs/AttachmentJsonData.html.abstract: The AttachmentJsonData struct represents a DIDComm attachment containing JSON data.

Structs/AttachmentDescriptor.html.name: AttachmentDescriptor
Structs/AttachmentDescriptor.html.abstract: The AttachmentDescriptor struct represents metadata for a DIDComm attachment.

Structs/Secret.html.name: Secret
Structs/Secret.html.abstract: Represents a secret, which is a piece of secret material and its type.

Structs/Seed.html.name: Seed
Structs/Seed.html.abstract: Represents a seed used for key generation.

Structs/VerifiableCredentialTypeContaine.name: VerifiableCredentialTypeContainer
Structs/VerifiableCredentialTypeContaine.abstract: A struct representing a container for verifiable credential types.

Structs/ConnectionAccept.html.name: ConnectionAccept
Structs/ConnectionAccept.html.abstract: A struct representing a connection acceptance message in the DIDComm protocol.

Structs/ConnectionRequest.html.name: ConnectionRequest
Structs/ConnectionRequest.html.abstract: A struct representing a connection request message in the DIDComm protocol.

Structs/OutOfBandInvitation.html.name: OutOfBandInvitation
Structs/OutOfBandInvitation.html.abstract: Represents an out-of-band invitation message in the DIDComm protocol.

Protocols/MediatorHandler.html#/s:10Pris.abstract: Boots the registered mediator associated with the mediator handler.

Protocols/Pluto.html.name: Pluto
Protocols/Pluto.html.abstract: The Pluto protocol defines the set of storage operations that are used in the Atala PRISM architecture. It provides an interface for storage operations in a portable, storage-agnostic manner, allowing data to be stored and retrieved using a variety of storage solutions.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: parseDID(str:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: parseDID parses a string representation of a Decentralized Identifier (DID) into a DID object. This function may throw an error if the string is not a valid DID.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: createPrismDID(masterPublicKey:services:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: createPrismDID creates a DID for a prism (a device or server that acts as a DID owner and controller) using a given master public key and list of services. This function may throw an error if the master public key or services are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: createPeerDID(keyAgreementPublicKey:authenticationPublicKey:services:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: createPeerDID creates a DID for a peer (a device or server that acts as a DID subject) using given key agreement and authentication key pairs and a list of services. This function may throw an error if the key pairs or services are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: resolveDID(did:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: resolveDID asynchronously resolves a DID to its corresponding DID Document. This function may throw an error if the DID is invalid or the document cannot be retrieved.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: verifySignature(did:challenge:signature:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: verifySignature asynchronously verifies the authenticity of a signature using the corresponding DID, challenge, and signature data. This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the signature is valid or not. This function may throw an error if the DID or signature data are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: verifySignature(document:challenge:signature:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: verifySignature verifies the authenticity of a signature using the corresponding DID Document, challenge, and signature data. This function returns a boolean value indicating whether the signature is valid or not. This function may throw an error if the DID Document or signature data are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.name: getEcnumbasis(did:publicKey:)
Protocols/Castor.html#/s:6Domain6CastorP.abstract: getEcnumbasis generates a unique ECNUM basis string for a given DID and key pair. This function may throw an error if the DID or key pair are invalid.

Protocols/Castor.html.name: Castor
Protocols/Castor.html.abstract: The Castor protocol defines the set of decentralized identifier (DID) operations that are used in the Atala PRISM architecture. It provides a way for users to create, manage, and control their DIDs and associated cryptographic keys.
